snippet: Stocks that moved substantially or traded heavily Monday:

headline.main: Apple and Exxon Mobil Climb While Bristol-Myers Tumbles
headline.print_headline: Apple and Exxon Mobil Climb While Bristol-Myers Tumbles

snippet: The justices will hear arguments about whether Samsung must pay Apple about $400 million for copying part of the iPhoneâ€™s design; Sony will offer the $399 PlayStation VR.

headline.main: Apple and Samsung Clash in the Supreme Court, and Sony Goes Virtual
headline.print_headline: Apple-Samsung Clash, and Sony Goes Virtual

snippet: Apple Inc's stock on Monday jumped 2.3 percent, reaching a high not seen since December, after rival Samsung Electronics Co Ltd suspended production of its flagship Galaxy Note 7 smartphones following reports of fires in replacement devices.

headline.main: Apple Stock Hits Highest Since December on Samsung Note 7 Fire Crisis
headline.print_headline: Apple Stock Hits Highest Since December on Samsung Note 7 Fire Crisis

snippet: U.S. stocks rose on Monday as energy shares gained with oil prices and as Apple jumped due to rival Samsung Electronics' worsening smartphone recall crisis.

headline.main: Wall Street Gains With Energy Shares; Apple Up on Samsung Woes
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Gains With Energy Shares; Apple Up on Samsung Woes

snippet: After five years of litigation, the U.S. Supreme Court will hear arguments on Tuesday in the bitter patent dispute between the world's two top smartphone manufacturers over the amount Samsung should pay Apple for copying the iPhone's distinctive l...

headline.main: U.S. Top Court to Hear Apple-Samsung Feud Over iPhone Designs
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court to Hear Apple-Samsung Feud Over iPhone Designs

snippet: The latest on developments in global financial markets (all times local):

headline.main: Markets Right Now: US Stocks Close Solidly Higher
headline.print_headline: Markets Right Now: US Stocks Close Solidly Higher

snippet: EU regulators who are investigating whether Alphabet unit Google is abusing its market power have has not extended their scrutiny to its tax deals with national authorities across Europe, the EU's antitrust chief  said on Monday.

headline.main: EU's Vestager Says Not Investigating Google's European Tax Deals
headline.print_headline: EU's Vestager Says Not Investigating Google's European Tax Deals

snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd halted sales of its Galaxy Note 7 smartphones on Tuesday and told owners to stop using them while it investigates reports of fires, fuelling expectations the tech giant will scrap the flagship device.

headline.main: Samsung Halts Galaxy Note 7 Sales Over Fire Concerns, Tells Users to Switch Off
headline.print_headline: Samsung Halts Galaxy Note 7 Sales Over Fire Concerns, Tells Users to Switch Off

snippet: Samsung said Tuesday it is halting sales of the star-crossed Galaxy Note 7 smartphone after a spate of fires involving new devices that were supposed to be safe replacements for recalled models.

headline.main: Samsung Halts Sales of Galaxy Note 7 After New Troubles
headline.print_headline: Samsung Halts Sales of Galaxy Note 7 After New Troubles

snippet: Verizon Communications Inc, the largest U.S. wireless carrier, may shift marketing away from Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's troubled Galaxy Note 7 mobile phone heading into the critical holiday selling season, a company spokeswoman said on Monday.

headline.main: Verizon May Shift Holiday Marketing Away From Note 7: Spokeswoman
headline.print_headline: Verizon May Shift Holiday Marketing Away From Note 7: Spokeswoman
